title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: can install development version RStudioBackupPrefs GitHub : Additionally fond librarian package, can install package :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs") # install.packages("librarian")   # librarian::shelf() will install or load the package if already installed. # You can queue up multiple package in one line.  librarian::shelf(Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs)

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: basic example shows use package:
code: # Backup your preferences to a GitHub repository library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE)  # Import your preferences: # Use clone_git = TRUE if you haven't imported your preference files yet start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE)  # Once your preferences are imported, indicate the path to file preferences: start_import_prefs("MyRStudioPrefs/R/rstudio_preferences/")

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: information, please checkout function documentation ?start_import_prefs ?start_backup_prefs use GitHub functionalities, need initiated repository. Simply initiate one : Make sure put user.name user.email global config. , go Terminal write : Check Happy Git R information. Note SSH method complex less recommended.
code: # Backup offline library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(copy_to_local = TRUE)   # If you are fine with leaving files in your R Studio preference folder: start_backup_prefs()  # Use open_backup_path = TRUE to see your files in the explorer: start_backup_prefs(open_backup_path = TRUE) # Assuming you're in your desired folder path: usethis::use_git() usethis::use_github()  # Optional: usethis::git_vaccinate()  # Set your credentials if needed: gitcreds::gitcreds_set() git init git config --global user.name "YOUR FULL NAME" git config --global user.email "YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Minh-Anh Huynh. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Huynh M (2023). RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup RStudio preferences easily import another computer github. https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs, https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github},   author = {Minh-Anh Huynh},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs, https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/}, }

what: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: goal RStudioBackupPrefs provide easy online way backup restore R Studio preferences. reference, following files backed : addins.json rstudio_bindings.json rstudio-prefs.json r.snippets Credits pat-s/rstudioSettings idea getting inspiration backup code.

title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: can install development version RStudioBackupPrefs GitHub : Additionally fond librarian package, can install package :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs") # install.packages("librarian")   # librarian::shelf() will install or load the package if already installed. # You can queue up multiple package in one line.  librarian::shelf(Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs)

title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: basic example shows use package:
code: # Backup your preferences to a GitHub repository library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE)  # Import your preferences: # Use clone_git = TRUE if you haven't imported your preference files yet start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE)  # Once your preferences are imported, indicate the path to file preferences: start_import_prefs("MyRStudioPrefs/R/rstudio_preferences/")

title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: information, please checkout function documentation ?start_import_prefs ?start_backup_prefs use GitHub functionalities, need initiated repository. Simply initiate one : Make sure put user.name user.email global config. , go Terminal write : Check Happy Git R information. Note SSH method complex less recommended.
code: # Backup offline library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(copy_to_local = TRUE)   # If you are fine with leaving files in your R Studio preference folder: start_backup_prefs()  # Use open_backup_path = TRUE to see your files in the explorer: start_backup_prefs(open_backup_path = TRUE) # Assuming you're in your desired folder path: usethis::use_git() usethis::use_github()  # Optional: usethis::git_vaccinate()  # Set your credentials if needed: gitcreds::gitcreds_set() git init git config --global user.name "YOUR FULL NAME" git config --global user.email "YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS"

what: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: Copy rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak R Studio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
code: backup_prefs(   open_backup_path = FALSE,   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: open_backup_path logical: TRUE FALSE. Open preference folder end backing convenience. rstudio_pref_path string: Default rstudio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: Copy rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak R Studio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
code: backup_prefs(open_backup_path = FALSE)

what: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: Copy backup files chosen local folder

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
code: copy_files_to_local(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: preference_path string: Use relative file path, add "/" end. rstudio_pref_path string: Default RStudio preference path.

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: Copy addins.json, r.snippets, rstudio_bindings.json, prefs.json folder working directory

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
code: copy_files_to_local() #> ✔ Preferences files copied to

what: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: Pull (clone) git repository contain backup preference files. function attempt pull current git repository default.

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
code: import_from_github(clone_git = FALSE, target_dir = NULL)

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: clone_git boolean. Use option initiated repository.

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: Clone pull GitHub link user prompt.

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
code: import_from_github() #> Pull git repository. #> Error in libgit2::git_remote_fetch: object not found - no match for id (9a6792cbbd9fa5bfa8d03acfab43ed59850d7a89) import_from_github(clone_git = TRUE) #> Enter the URL of your repository:  #> Error in libgit2::git_clone: '/home/runner/work/RStudioBackupPrefs/RStudioBackupPrefs/docs/reference' exists and is not an empty directory

what: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: Import local preferences files R Studio

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
code: import_local_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: preference_path string: Relative folder_path .json files contained. rstudio_pref_path string: Default rstudio_config_path.

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: Import addins.json, rstudio_bindings.json, r.snippets keybindings folder rstudio-prefs.json RStudio folder

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
code: import_local_prefs("R/rstudio_preferences/") #> Error in check_json_existence(preference_path): No .json preference files are found. Please check the file path.

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
text: Function start backing files folder .bak. Make sure git initiated repository wish upload GitHub repository.

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
code: start_backup_prefs(   github_backup = FALSE,   copy_to_local = FALSE,   open_backup_path = FALSE,   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   git_message = "Backup of R Studio preferences on {Sys.Date()}",   repository = "." )

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
text: github_backup boolean: Upload file github. copy_to_local boolean: Copy .json files local TRUE. open_backup_path boolean: Open default backup folder convenience TRUE. preference_path string: Path local backup folder git_message string: git commit message. Default Backup R Studio preferences Sys.Date()." repository string. Defaults current git repository.

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
text: Copy rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak files native config folder. copy files working directory path executes git push github_backup = TRUE

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
text: Function wrapper using backup_prefs(). github_backup = TRUE, use functions: copy_files_to_local() upload_prefs_to_github()

title: Start the backup process — start_backup_prefs
code: # Leave defaults to simply backup. start_backup_prefs()  # Customize preferences and git_message start_backup_prefs(   github_backup = TRUE,   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   git_message = "Backup preferences" ) #> ✔ Preferences files copied to #> Error in check_json_existence(preference_path): No .json preference files are found. Please check the file path.

what: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
title: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
text: Import preferences cloning link pulling GitHub. function start pull currently active GitHub repository, import local .json preference files. function look specific .json files , given file path.

title: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
code: start_import_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   github = TRUE,   clone_git = FALSE,   target_dir = c(NULL, "parent", ...) )

title: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
text: preference_path string: Input file path preferences.json files located. github boolean: Use TRUE pull clone GitHub, otherwise FALSE just import local files. clone_git boolean: Default FALSE. Clone git first time usage. convenience function avoid manually, essentially git_clone("github_url"). clone repository inside current working directory specified target directory. target_dir string: desired file path clone cloned github directory. Use "parent" get parent directory current directory.

title: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
text: Pull github import preferences R Studio preference folder.

title: Start the import process from local files or from GitHub — start_import_prefs
text: Function wrapper import_from_github() followed import_local_prefs()

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: Add, commit push .json files automatically name

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
code: upload_prefs_to_github(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   git_message = "Backup of R Studio preferences on {Sys.Date()}.",   repository = "." )

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: preference_path string. Relative file path name git_message string. Enter git commit message. repository string. Defaults current git repository.

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: Upload .json files currently active git repository.

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
code: # Upload preferences to currently active git repository upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/") #> Error in check_json_existence(preference_path): No .json preference files are found. Please check the file path.  # Upload preferences to currently active git repository with a custom git commit message upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/", git_message = "Backup preferences") #> Error in check_json_existence(preference_path): No .json preference files are found. Please check the file path. #'
